docs.snippet: Gold shipped abroad in September was smaller in amount than in either of the two preceding months and was consigned, as in those months, principally to France. It was the third consecutive month without imports. Of the gold exported all was released...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gold shipped abroad in September was smaller in amount than in either of the two preceding months and was consigned, as in those months, principally to France. It was the third consecutive month without imports. Of the gold exported all was released from earmark, except $4,666,400, which amount was lost to the monetary gold stock, of the United States.
docs.abstract: Rept for Sept on exports; no imports; table giving details of fine gold shipments and prices

headline.main: EXPORTS OF GOLD OFF IN SEPTEMBER; $53,972,800 Was Sent Abroad, Mostly to France -- All but $4,666,400 Earmarked. NO IMPORTS REPORTED Loss of the Metal by United States So Far This Year Is Put at $165,495,000.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2 -- With flags flying, military bands playing and two regiments drawn up as a guard of honor, President Justo boarded a train this morning for Mar del Plata, where he embarked on the battleship Moreno this afternoon for Rio de...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 2 -- With flags flying, military bands playing and two regiments drawn up as a guard of honor, President Justo boarded a train this morning for Mar del Plata, where he embarked on the battleship Moreno this afternoon for Rio de Janeiro to visit President Vargas of Brazil.

headline.main: REVOLT CRUSHED, JUST TO STARTS TRIP; Argentine President Leaves on Warship for Brazil to Sign Trade Treaty. 23 ARRESTED IN PLOT Police Reveal Wide Uprising Was Planned -- Washington Fears Snag in Commercial Pact.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 4. -- For the country that first told the world "if an opposition did not exist it would have to be invented," William G.A. Ormsby-Gore took up in the League of Nations Assembly commission dealing with minorities here today "the...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 4. -- For the country that first told the world "if an opposition did not exist it would have to be invented," William G.A. Ormsby-Gore took up in the League of Nations Assembly commission dealing with minorities here today "the challenge of Dr. Goebbels," the German Minister of Propaganda, in calling Parliaments obsolete.
docs.abstract: Dutch resolution for coordination of work approved by League of Nations Assembly comm

headline.main: BRITON DENOUNCES NAZI RACIAL VIEWS AT GENEVA SESSION; Ormsby-Gore Scores Dogma of Homogeneity and Boasts of Mixture in Britain. CITES EQUALITY IN EMPIRE Rejecting German Minorities Concept, He Says It 'Frankly Makes Us Nervous.' BRITON RIDICULES NAZI RACIAL VIEWS

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREIT.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES.By CLARENCE K. STREIT

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Oct. 5 -- Despite pressure from some student and professor elements, the Students Directorate declared today that it had resolved to continue its control over the government and carry out its revolutionary program. The decision was made at an...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Oct. 5 -- Despite pressure from some student and professor elements, the Students Directorate declared today that it had resolved to continue its control over the government and carry out its revolutionary program. The decision was made at an all-night session.
docs.abstract: Students' directorate votes not to give up control and offers to cooperate with ABC group

headline.main: CUBAN STUDENTS VOTE NOT TO GIVE UP RULE; Directorate Decides to Negotiate With ABC Group Offering to Cooperate in Revolution.

docs.snippet: Taking the Republic of Uruguay to task as having made insufficient provision for service on its bonds held by American investors, the Institute of International Finance indicates that British creditors are receiving better treatment. The institute,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Taking the Republic of Uruguay to task as having made insufficient provision for service on its bonds held by American investors, the Institute of International Finance indicates that British creditors are receiving better treatment. The institute, which is conducted by the Investment Bankers Association in cooperation with New York University, issued yesterday a bulletin on the republic's finances.
docs.abstract: Accuses Uruguay of giving Brit investors better treatment than those in U S

headline.main: URUGUAY ACCUSED BY CREDITORS HERE; British Investors Said to Get Better Treatment Than Those in America.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 -- The United States and International Securities Corporation, a Dillon, Read  Co. investment trust, had a shrinkage of $26,562,400 in its portfolio securities up to Dec. 31, 1932, according to testimony today before the Senate...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 10 -- The United States and International Securities Corporation, a Dillon, Read Co. investment trust, had a shrinkage of $26,562,400 in its portfolio securities up to Dec. 31, 1932, according to testimony today before the Senate Banking and Currency subcommittee investigating stock market operations.
docs.abstract: E B Tracy testifies on sale of R R stocks by U S & Internatl Securities Corp to U S & Foreign Securities Corp and later repurchase

headline.main: DILLON TRUST'S LIST FELL $26,562,400; Rock Island and Frisco Stock Accounted for Chief Loss, Tracy Tells Senators. BOUGHT IN 'PANIC WEEK' Head of 'U.S. and International' Still Thought Rails Desirable, He Testifies.
